sentences.en: " I'll split kindling tomorrow, " he said over his thin ragged shoulder.
sentences.cn: “ 明天我劈引火柴, ” 他回过头来又说,衬衣的肩部都磨薄磨破了.

sentences.en: A ragged shout went up from the small crowd.
sentences.cn: 这一小群人发出了刺耳的喊叫.

sentences.en: Crowds of ragged children played among the rocks.
sentences.cn: 一群群破衣烂衫的孩子在岩石间玩耍。

sentences.en: He's walking a dog with a ragged coat of fair.
sentences.cn: 他在溜一只毛长得长短不齐的狗.

sentences.en: I could hear the sound of his ragged breathing.
sentences.cn: 我能够听到他那急促的呼吸声。

sentences.en: In the corridor were four dirty, ragged bundles, just identifiable as human beings.
sentences.cn: 走廊里有4团脏兮兮、破破烂烂的东西，依稀可辨是人。

sentences.en: Mother looked down, and there beside her was a little ragged girl. "
sentences.cn: 妈低下头, 看见身旁是个衣衫破烂的小女孩. ”

sentences.en: My cuticles were split and ragged, and my nails unevenly bitten.
sentences.cn: 我指甲根部的表皮龟裂粗糙，指甲被咬得参差不齐。

sentences.en: O'Brien formed the men into a ragged line.
sentences.cn: 奥布赖恩让那些人排成了参差不齐的一列。
粗糙的指甲划过她的皮肤。

sentences.en: She could hear his ragged breathing, as if he had been running.
sentences.cn: 她能听到他不均匀的呼吸声，似乎他是跑着过来的。

sentences.en: Spain ran England ragged early on but goalkeeper Ian Walker proved a formidable barrier.
sentences.cn: 西班牙队先是猛烈进攻，使英格兰队疲于奔命，但守门员伊恩·沃克防守甚严。

sentences.en: The ends of the sleeves of his coat were frayed and ragged.
sentences.cn: 上衣的袖口已经磨烂了.

sentences.en: The five survivors eventually reached safety, ragged, half-starved and exhausted.
sentences.cn: 5位幸存者最终到达安全之地时已经衣衫褴褛、饥肠辘辘、精疲力尽。

sentences.en: the ragged blankets on the bed
They fell into a sort of broken, ragged line.
sentences.cn: 他们排成了断断续续 、 参差不齐的一队.

words.tran_cn: 衣衫褴褛的人（尤指贫穷褴褛的儿童）
贱民；乌合之众；下层社会

phrases.tran_cn: [美国俚语](妇女)正行经的，月经来潮的
斗牛用的红布；激怒人的东西

trans.tran_cn: 衣着破烂的，衣衫褴褛的，参差不齐的，凹凸不平的，粗糙刺耳的
trans.tran_en: You can say that something is ragged when it is rough or uneven
